place.name: SPANBY
place.gazetteerText: SPANBY, a parish in Sleaford district, Lincoln; 5 miles SSE of Sleaford r. station. Post town, Falkingham. Acres, 1,019. Real property, £1,374. Pop., 75. Houses, 15. The manor belongs to W. Cragg, Esq. The living is a rectory, annexed to Swaton. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
